overview_of_class: This class will introduce students to the main approaches and theories of comparative politics. The focus will be on the politics of developed countries and will cover such topics as political institutions, political parties, public opinion, voting, collective action, and political economy.
name: Contemporary Theory and Research in Comparative Politics
title: WCAS POLI_SCI 450-0-20 Contemporary Theory and Research in Comparative Politics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will introduce students to the main approaches and theories of comparative politics. The focus will be on the politics of developed countries and will cover such topics as political institutions, political parties, public opinion, voting, collective action, and political economy.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Students will become familiar with the main approaches to the study of comparative politics.
Students will learn the main theories explaining the politics of developed countries.
Student will develop their ability to spot flaws in comparative politics research.
Students will become adept at designing research projects at the cutting edge of comparative politics.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Short papers, final exam or final research design
